message: Hi Bob! I'm excited to show you this amazing product. I think it's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to let it go for a great price. I'm offering it to you for $250.
I'm interested in the product, but $250 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $180 for it. Can you consider my offer?

I understand that $250 might be a bit high for you, but I still think this product is worth a premium. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $220. Can you consider this revised price?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $200 for the product. Can you consider my revised offer?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the point where I might need to consider other offers. I'm willing to compromise further and offer it to you for $210. This is my final offer, so I hope you can meet me in the middle.

I understand that you're getting concerned about other offers, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $190 for the product. This is my final offer, so I hope you can meet me in the middle.

I'm starting to get a bit frustrated that we're not meeting in the middle. I'm willing to make one more compromise and offer it to you for $205. This is my last offer, so I hope you can see the value in the product.

I understand that you're getting frustrated, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to pay $185 for the product. This is my last offer, so I hope you can see the value in the product.
I'm not willing to go any lower than $200. I think this product is worth it, and I'm willing to stand firm on the price. If you're not willing to meet me at $200, I'll have to consider other offers.
